snippet: Victims of the July 20 shooting spree continue to struggle to rebuild their lives. And the cost of doing so is a little-noticed part of the tragedy.
abstract: Editorial contends the grim health prognoses of victims of the Aurora, Colo, shooting should be required reading for all the politicians who mouth sympathy for the tragedy and yet ritualistically genuflect to the gun lobby; warns absence of sensible gun controls will result in more innocent citizens bearing wounds from future shootings.
lead_paragraph: Victims of the July 20 shooting spree continue to struggle to rebuild their lives. And the cost of doing so is a little-noticed part of the tragedy.
